file.skeleton:
Transition in localization – From Automation to Agentic AI

The emergence of AI Agents has disrupted the localization industry, redefining its scope on the macro level, as well as in the details of daily operations. Developing into sophisticated systems with the capability to make autonomous decisions, these agents are becoming active participants in localization workflows. Within this context, it is crucial for localizers to clarify what AI Agents can and cannot do. With careful stewardship, well-designed applications of AI agents have the potential to become invaluable human allies, to foster innovation, as well as improve efficiency and productivity. The seventh Multilingual AI roundtable will focus on key components of this transition, such as AI-driven workflow orchestration, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)-based MT with Large Language Models (LLMs) , as well as possible applications and unique challenges of working with LLM agents.

Topics to be discussed:

  • RAG-based MT with LLMs
  • AI-driven Content Orchestration System
  • Intelligent Multilingual Information Retrieval
  • Auto Localization Quality Assurance (LQA) and Quality Estimation (QE)
  • Steering Agentic AI: Human role and human-computer collaboration
  • Knowledge graphs and AI data management
  • Applications and risks of AI Agents

    By joining this round table, you will:

  • Understand what AI Agents can and cannot do
  • Gather insights to apply and manage AI Agents at the enterprise level
  • Design innovated localization workflow with AI Agents as an active participant
  • Discuss industry best practices to manage both people and AI Agents
  • Consider future trends in the AI space
  • Develop valuable connections with industry peers

    This round table is for:

  • Decision-makers who aim to leverage AI on both strategic and operational levels
  • Buyers who want to implement Multilingual AI
  • Project Managers tasked with implementing an MT/AI solution
  • Vendors who want to leverage MT/AI to meet their clients’ needs
  • IT professionals involved in MT/AI implementation
  • Content Managers responsible for global content

    Pre-roundtable webinar

    This roundtable will provide a webinar to address potential technological knowledge gaps to help participants prepare for the in-person roundtable discussions.

segment.source: Multilingual AI Roundtable 2025 in Malmö!
segment.target: Meertalige AI-rondetafel 2025 in Malmö!

segment.source: Transition in localization – From Automation to Agentic AIThe emergence of AI Agents has disrupted the localization industry, redefining its scope on the macro level, as well as in the details of daily operations. Developing into sophisticated systems with the capability to make autonomous decisions, these agents are becoming active participants in localization workflows. Within this context, it is crucial for localizers to clarify what AI Agents can and cannot do. With careful stewardship, well-designed applications of AI agents have the potential to become invaluable human allies, to foster innovation, as well as improve efficiency and productivity. The seventh Multilingual AI roundtable will focus on key components of this transition, such as AI-driven workflow orchestration, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)-based MT with Large Language Models (LLMs) , as well as possible applications and unique challenges of working with LLM agents.Topics to be discussed:
segment.target: Overgang in lokalisatie - van automatisering naar AI via agentsDe opkomst van AI-agenten heeft de lokalisatie-industrie ontwricht en de reikwijdte ervan opnieuw gedefinieerd, zowel op macroniveau als in de details van de dagelijkse werkzaamheden. Deze agenten ontwikkelen zich tot geavanceerde systemen die autonome beslissingen kunnen nemen en worden actieve deelnemers aan lokalisatieworkflows. Binnen deze context is het cruciaal voor lokaliseerders om duidelijk te maken wat AI-agenten wel en niet kunnen doen. Met zorgvuldig beheer hebben goed ontworpen toepassingen van AI-agenten het potentieel om waardevolle menselijke bondgenoten te worden, innovatie te bevorderen en de efficiëntie en productiviteit te verbeteren. De zevende rondetafel over meertalige AI richt zich op belangrijke onderdelen van deze overgang, zoals AI-gestuurde workfloworkestratie, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)-gebaseerde MT met grote taalmodellen (LLM's), evenals mogelijke toepassingen en unieke uitdagingen van het werken met LLM-agenten.Te bespreken onderwerpen:
